titleStmt.title: The Pope's supremacy confuted. By King Edward the VI. Translated out of his French original
titleStmt.author: Edward VI, King of England, 1537-1553.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1547-1553 : Edward VI)

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.D. for Jonathan Robinson, at the Golden-Lion in St. Paul's Church-Yard,

notesStmt.note: Caption title on pg. 1: A small treatise against the primacy of the Pope.
Running title: King Edward the sixth, against the Pope's supremacy.
According to preface, text was written when "he was but twelve Years old".
Reproduction of the original at the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the Golden-Lion in St. Paul's Church-Yard
